The firefox.exe process remains forever (at least more than hours) after I selected "Exit" from the menu bar.  It uses 50% of my dual core machine's CPU time.  By attaching the Visual Studio debugger to the process, I can confirm an audio thread keeps running.

The steps to reproduce:
1) Connect a USB audio device and make it the default one.
2) Start Firefox in Safe Mode with a new profile.
3) Disconnect the audio device and connect again.
4) Visit a page with an audio tag such as http://moztw.org/demo/audioplayer/ and make the audio play back.
5) Leave the page and select "Exit" from the menu bar.

Probably Firefox does not handle device disconnetion properly and causes a deadlock.

(In reply to Matthew Gregan [:kinetik] from comment #4)
> What page/video did this happen with, and do you have a way to reproduce it?

As described in the original report, I can reproduce this problem with http://moztw.org/demo/audioplayer/ .  But it requires you to disconnect/reconnect the default audio device while Firefox is running.  Automatic device disconnection may also happen when the system goes into standby.
